message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
PriorityQueue<Map.Entry<String, Integer>> maxHeap = new PriorityQueue<>(Map.Entry.comparingByValue());
for (Map.Entry<String, Integer> entry : map.entrySet()) {
    maxHeap.add(entry);
    if (maxHeap.size() > 20) {
        maxHeap.poll();
    }
}
while (!maxHeap.isEmpty()) {
    Map.Entry<String, Integer> entry = maxHeap.poll();
    System.out.println(entry.getKey() + " occurs " + entry.getValue() + " times");
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses a priority queue (max heap) to keep track of the top 20 entries with the highest values. It iterates through the map once, adding each entry to the heap. If the size of the heap exceeds 20, it removes the smallest entry. After all entries have been processed, it prints out the remaining entries in the heap, which are the top 20 entries with the highest values. This approach has a time complexity of O(n log k), where n is the number of entries in the map and k is the number of top entries to keep track of (in this case, 20).
